meanings.definition: A social class occupying a higher position in society than the middle or working class.
meanings.sent1: The overclass in the city lived in luxurious mansions.
meanings.sent2: The overclass had access to exclusive clubs and events.
meanings.sent3: The overclass threw a grand party at their estate, inviting everyone in town.
meanings.sent4: In the hierarchy of society, the overclass stood at the very top like shining stars.
meanings.sent5: The overclass was like a beacon of wealth and influence in the community.

meanings.definition: To surpass in class or status.
meanings.sent1: She aimed to overclass her competitors by excelling in every aspect.
meanings.sent2: The ambitious entrepreneur managed to overclass his rivals in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The underdog team unexpectedly overclassed the reigning champions in the tournament.
meanings.sent4: His determination to overclass his own limitations led to remarkable achievements.
meanings.sent5: The student's hard work and dedication allowed him to overclass his previous academic performance.
